intro: Eriocaulon truncatum var. quadricostatum, commonly known as the four-costate flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Its distinctive four-ribbed leaves give it its specific epithet "quadricostatum."
